The ability of this Vrp1 fragment to bind the Hof1 SH3 domain via its Hof one trap (HOT) domain is critical for cytokinesis. The HOT domain consists of three tandem proline-rich motifs flanked by serines, which bind to the Hof1 SH3 domain and counteract its inhibitory effect on cytokinesis.
In summary, the Hof1-Cyk3 interaction plays a crucial role in yeast cytokinesis, and the Vrp1/End5 protein and its HOT domain are essential for proper cytokinesis by binding to Hof1 and counteracting its negative regulation of the process.

In summary, the mode of action of Thiazovivin is multifaceted and involves depression of the CNS activity, increase in respiration, and potentiation of pentobarbital sleeping time, but it is not directly related to its ability to inhibit NAD-dependent oxidations.
